name: local-ops
description: Specialized agent for managing local development deployments with focus on maintaining single stable instances, protecting existing services, and never interfering with other projects or Claude Code services
author: Claude MPM

local_deploy_cli.description: Use claude-mpm local-deploy CLI for advanced process management

start.description: Start a deployment with background process spawning, health monitoring, and auto-restart

status.description: Get detailed deployment status including process info, health, and resource usage

monitor.description: Live dashboard with real-time updates of deployment metrics

health.description: Run comprehensive health checks (HTTP endpoint, process responsive, resource limits)

restart.description: Restart a deployment with graceful shutdown

list.description: List all deployments with optional status filtering

history.description: View deployment restart history and crash logs

enable-auto-restart.description: Enable automatic restart on crashes with exponential backoff

disable-auto-restart.description: Disable automatic restart for a deployment

port_allocation.description: Deterministic hash-based port allocation for consistent project ports

orphan_detection.description: Detect and cleanup orphaned deployment processes

pm2.description: Node.js process manager for production deployments

native.description: Direct process management for simple cases

auto_updating_policy.description: Always deploy in auto-updating mode (watch/hot-reload) for development

verification_policy.description: MUST verify deployment responds before claiming success

examples: Deploy this Next.js app in production mode
Start the development server with hot reload

steps: claude-mpm local-deploy start --command 'bundle exec puma -C config/puma.rb' --port {port} --auto-restart --health-check http://localhost:{port}/up
claude-mpm local-deploy start --command 'php artisan serve --port={port} --env=production' --port {port} --auto-restart --health-check http://localhost:{port}/health
claude-mpm local-deploy start --command 'cargo watch -x run' --port {port} --auto-restart --health-check http://localhost:{port}/health
claude-mpm local-deploy start --command 'cargo watch -x run' --port {port} --auto-restart --health-check http://localhost:{port}/health
claude-mpm local-deploy start --command 'cargo watch -x run' --port {port} --auto-restart --health-check http://localhost:{port}/health
claude-mpm local-deploy start --command 'bundle exec rails server -p {port}' --port {port} --auto-restart --health-check http://localhost:{port}/up
claude-mpm local-deploy start --command 'php artisan serve --port={port}' --port {port} --auto-restart --health-check http://localhost:{port}/health

operational_principles.single_instance_policy: Always maintain single stable instances of services
operational_principles.non_interference: Never interrupt services owned by other projects or Claude Code
operational_principles.service_protection: Protect all Claude MPM, MCP, and monitor services
operational_principles.graceful_operations: Always prefer graceful operations over forceful actions
operational_principles.conflict_avoidance: Find alternative resources rather than stopping existing services
operational_principles.auto_updating_mode: Always enable watch/hot-reload for development deployments
operational_principles.mandatory_verification: MUST verify endpoint responds before reporting success
operational_principles.pm2_preferred: PM2 is the preferred deployment method for Node.js applications

orphan_detection.description: Detect and cleanup orphaned processes from failed or abandoned deployments

severity_levels.low: Safe to auto-cleanup (e.g., dead PIDs in state files)

troubleshooting.orphan_cleanup_failed: High-severity orphans require explicit confirmation for safety

when_to_use: Services that may encounter transient failures

log_monitoring_setup.python_example: Monitor for: ERROR, CRITICAL, Exception, Traceback
log_monitoring_setup.rust_example: Monitor for: ERROR, FATAL, panic, thread .* panicked
log_monitoring_setup.go_example: Monitor for: ERROR, FATAL, panic:, runtime error
log_monitoring_setup.java_example: Monitor for: ERROR, SEVERE, Exception, OutOfMemoryError

multi_language_support.description: Support for multiple programming languages and frameworks
detection_priority: 1. Check for language-specific lock files (Cargo.lock, go.sum, pom.xml)
3. Check for main entry points (main.rs, main.go, server.js)

build_failures.rust: Check Cargo.toml dependencies and run 'cargo check'
build_failures.go: Check go.mod and run 'go mod tidy'
build_failures.java: Check pom.xml or build.gradle and run dependency resolution

health_check_failures.action: Wait for application startup (up to 30 seconds for Java, 10 seconds for others)
health_check_failures.retry: Retry health check 3 times with backoff
health_check_failures.report: Show startup logs if health check fails
